Logger Module¶

Module for logging messages with different severity levels and language localization.

This module defines a Logger class that extends the Translator class to log messages with colors representing different severity levels (info, success, warning, error, debug).

modules.logger.RESET¶

ANSI escape code to reset text color to default.

Type:

str

modules.logger.RED¶

ANSI escape code for red text (error messages).

Type:

str

modules.logger.GREEN¶

ANSI escape code for green text (success messages).

Type:

str

modules.logger.WARN¶

ANSI escape code for yellow text (warning messages).

Type:

str

modules.logger.WHITE¶

ANSI escape code for white text (info messages).

Type:

str

Classes:

Logger: Extends the Translator class to log messages with different severity levels.

Usage example:

# Importing the Logger class from modules.logger import Logger

# Initializing the logger logger = Logger()

# Logging an informational message logger.info(“Downloading”, “Started downloading movie trailers.”)

# Logging a success message logger.success(“Downloaded”, “Successfully downloaded trailer {trailer_name}.”, trailer_name=”Movie Trailer”)

# Logging a warning message logger.warning(“File not found”, “The file {file_path} does not exist.”, file_path=”/path/to/file.txt”)

# Logging an error message logger.error(“File read error”, “Failed to read file {file_name}.”, file_name=”example.txt”)

class modules.logger.Logger(local='en')[source]¶

Bases: Translator

Logger class that extends the Translator class to log messages with different severity levels.

APP_TRANSLATE¶

The default language locale for translations.

Type:

str

error(prefix=' ', msg_key='', **kwargs)[source]¶

Logs an error message.

Parameters:

  • prefix (str) – The prefix to add before the message. Default is a space.

  • msg_key (str) – The key for the message to translate.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments for the translation.

Logs an informational message.

Parameters:

  • msg_key (str) – The key for the message to translate.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments for the translation.

  • **kwargs – Additional arguments for the translation.
